Text.Page:
There was once a man who was drowning. Nearby there was a rope made of vines.

A human passed by.
The human used the rope to rescue the man.

A high elf passed by.
The high elf evaporated the water with magic.

An aman passed by.
Without hesitation, the aman threw himself into the water and rescued the man.

A castanic passed by.
With the rope in his hand, the castanic said with a wicked smile, "How much is your life worth?"Next page

A popori passed by.
Without a second thought, the popori yelled "I'll save you!" and threw the rope into the water.

A baraka passed by.
After spotting the rope, the baraka started calculating the perfect amount of strength to save the man...and forgot that the man was still drownning.

Luckily an elin passing by dived in and saved the man.

(The next page is torn out.)Stop reading.
